meta.description: Cryptographic protocols defined over geometric trust topologies

node_registration.name: Geometric Handshake
steps: 1. Node generates keypair (sk, pk) mapped to point P on Trust Manifold
2. Node proves P is within 'Trusted Radius' R of Root using ZK-Proof
3. Authority verifies proof without learning exact P (Privacy-preserving)
node_registration.math: Verify dist(Root, P) < R using Zero-Knowledge Range Proofs

failure_modes.verification_failure: If ZK proof invalid: Ban node ID for T seconds (DoS prevention).
failure_modes.topology_mismatch: If node claims trusted region but proof fails: Reject connection and log 'Topology Violation' event.

constraints: Statement: P is on H^n (Hyperboloid) AND arccosh(-<P, Root>_L) < R

policy_evaluation.math: Boolean Point-in-Volume check: Is Action_Point inside Permitted_Volume?
policy_evaluation.implementation: Signed Distance Function (SDF) evaluation on Policy Manifold

consent_signing.concept: User signs the 'Geodesic Path' of the data, not just the data itself.
consent_signing.verification: Verify signature covers the entire spacetime curve of the operation.

zk_range_proofs.description: Zero-Knowledge proofs for range membership on hyperbolic manifolds

trajectory_signatures.description: Signing the geodesic path of an operation
